title: minerjones
author: minerjones
created_time: September 17, 2022, 01:42:43 PMLast edit: May 22, 2023, 10:49:43 AM by minerjones
content: "The United Decentralized Ledger" DIY paper wallet notesNotes are serialized from SB 000001F to SB 000100FEach note comes with 1x security sticker to place over private key once attachedpublic and private key area for printing out is 2 x 2 cm // 0.77 x 0.77 inchesNotes are $5 $4 each, no limitShipping based on number of notes and location.Payments accepted in BTC, LN, and Cashapp

comments.author: DirtyBirdE
comments.body: Iâ€™ll take 5 of these too! Sending PM

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: What are the dimensions of the notes themselves? I wonder if they can fit in a protective case like the ones you can put dollar bills in

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on September 20, 2022, 03:09:22 PMWhat are the dimensions of the notes themselves? I wonder if they can fit in a protective case like the ones you can put dollar bills in The notes measure:6 & 1/16 x 2 & 9/16 inches15.4 x 6.6 cmAnd fit perfectly into the standard currency sleeves:**If anyone wants, I can add them to the notes for $0.25 each.

comments.author: Jambo USA
comments.body: in for 2, with sleeves as well! Will shoot coins over to you later tonight/ tomorrow if that's cool!

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: I would be interested in some of these. Is there any more into on them at all?How many were produced? i would guess a high print run judging by the priceWhen were they produced?Any info on the weight of paper?and if it is by any chance watermarked?None of those Q's are deal breakers, I want to measure some other notes to get someextra sleeves!

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: aoluain on September 21, 2022, 06:56:57 AMI would be interested in some of these. Is there any more into on them at all?How many were produced? i would guess a high print run judging by the priceWhen were they produced?Any info on the weight of paper?and if it is by any chance watermarked?None of those Q's are deal breakers, I want to measure some other notes to get someextra sleeves!These were obtained in a larger lot of items, so no other info at the moment.I know there were similar notes produced earlier by same or similar maker that already had the keys generated.Below are pictures of these notes. Thanks to MoparMiningLLC for the pictures There were 100 notes in the lot I received, not sure if more were producedThey are dated "2020"The paper weighs 2.35~ grams and does not appear to have any watermarks.The "paper" is more of a light card-stock. Hope this helps with some of your questions

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Nice one MJ,I will take 4 notes and 15 plastic holders if possible please

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I have tested and printed public addresses on stickers (labels) and cut them to .75" to fit these bills - this is just FYI for anyone buying these, so you can add the public address to go with the private key you generate and attach to the note.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Received a message from the original owner/maker about the notes that gives a little more information:"I can confirm the notes from the picture are from the same maker as mine. As I've said before, this was a little test project I've made with my friend (the maker of the notes) for the first DiY Bitcoin banknotes. There were only 100 made. Originally, the notes were intended to be orange but they were made as yellow just to commemorate 10 years of Bitcoin's existence (from 2009 to 2019). The maker is known as Fowler Electronics on Etsy. He has his own site for crypto banknotes called "The Crypto Bill" which can be accessed here: https://thecryptobill.com/ "Etsy: https://www.etsy.com/shop/FowlerElectronicsWebsite: https://thecryptobill.com/

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Thanks for the link - I see 5 or 6 on the site thst I dont have - will remedy today

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: I bought some of these assembled notes from etsy. For the price they're quite nice, but the private keys can easily be read with a light, so they should not be loaded.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Hox on September 22, 2022, 10:47:17 PMI bought some of these assembled notes from etsy. For the price they're quite nice, but the private keys can easily be read with a light, so they should not be loaded.I never intended to load them so never even really tried to see if they were secure, so good to know that you did.maybe I will take some pics of this as I have 9 of their notes and send the pics to them. This should have been something their R&D / QA people should have picked up on.

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 23, 2022, 01:59:31 AM This should have been something their R&D / QA people should have picked up on.It's an easy thing to overlook for new makers. Polymerbit had the same issue with some of their early notes too.I had a closer look at my notes and noticed a few differences. My BTC note and ETH notes both have oval shaped icons in the middle vs Mopar's circular ones. Also the "USD Value" and "BTC Value" boxes are shorter on mine.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: Hox on September 23, 2022, 02:44:38 AMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 23, 2022, 01:59:31 AM This should have been something their R&D / QA people should have picked up on.It's an easy thing to overlook for new makers. Polymerbit had the same issue with some of their early notes too.I had a closer look at my notes and noticed a few differences. My BTC note and ETH notes both have oval shaped icons in the middle vs Mopar's circular ones. Also the "USD Value" and "BTC Value" boxes are shorter on mine. possibly different batches? the ones on their site currently are round not oval as well. when did you get yours?

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 23, 2022, 02:51:58 AMQuote from: Hox on September 23, 2022, 02:44:38 AMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 23, 2022, 01:59:31 AM This should have been something their R&D / QA people should have picked up on.It's an easy thing to overlook for new makers. Polymerbit had the same issue with some of their early notes too.I had a closer look at my notes and noticed a few differences. My BTC note and ETH notes both have oval shaped icons in the middle vs Mopar's circular ones. Also the "USD Value" and "BTC Value" boxes are shorter on mine. possibly different batches? the ones on their site currently are round not oval as well. when did you get yours?I bought them on etsy in 2018

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Mine had to be 2020 - so yea, has to be different series

comments.author: Jambo USA
comments.body: Just got mine in the mail today, solid pieces and solid packing. Wish I'd bought more off the rip since the paper is pretty thick and I may want to try and take a stab at using my laser engraver to put the keys on one of em, but would hate to ruin it lol.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: A few notes left for sale.PM me if interested
